data.title: Beautiful & Peaceful
data.text: Brought some out of towners here & they loved it! They could not believe this beautiful park in Flower Mound, was actually in Texas! They said maybe Michigan or Ohio!

data.title: Our boat is docked there and love that we're can boat whenever we want to
data.text: rented slip and lift: great location: easy access to the boat and the lake:  we can meet friends and go out for an hour or MORE

data.title: Still closed after almost two years
data.text: The park closed last year due to rain and is still closed this year.  There's a construction sign at the gate, but can't imagine why it's taking so long to reopen.

data.title: Still closed?
data.text:
I realize that this park is operated by the US Army Corps of engineers but they are bringing a whole new meaning to "good enough for government work" as far as reopening the park.
When is the park going to reopen we ask?

data.title: nice park, great place to spend some quiet time
data.text: I've been to this park on several occasions and always had an enjoyable visit. Its not crowded, always been clean and well maintained. Great place to take the kids for a picnic or just park and look at the lake.

data.title: Park re-born
data.text: When we moved to Flower Mound, this park had purposefully been closed due to it being a mecca for unsavory activity. The city had it closed for 2-3 years and just left it sitting, with it being impossible to get to the park without walking nearly a mile from the road. This apparently did the trick and the unwanted elements moved on. The park is now reopened with a gated entrance and fee to get in. Some people may complain about the fee, but considering how nice this park is, what it is intended for and what it used to be like.......I'll gladly pay the fee. Awesome place to take the family. Full details on the park are posted on the Flower Mound web site. Would have been 5 stars if not for the fees. Outside of that, this is a great place to visit.

data.title: Best Kept Secret in Flower Mound
data.text: This is a very nice park that can be used for jogging, camping or day trips. The entrance fee is $5.00 per car. The view is spectacular overlooking the lake, especially at sunset. The park custodian is very friendly and does an awesome job.

data.title: Great Place to go Hiking with Friends
data.text: The trails were not only clean, easily-visible, and showed great views, but were also perfect for bikers and hikers alike! The paths cross streams, bridges, cliffs, and the sparkling Grapevine Lake! The only downside is the Texas heat:-) Would recommend as a family excursion or a fun get-together with friends. Great experience at this park!

data.title: Nice quiet get away
data.text: This is actually an RV park that my husband and I discovered.  We stayed there one weekend and loved it!  It's small and quiet and right on Grapevine Lake.  Each site has a picnic table with a grill and all hookups are water and electric only but for a weekend stay it works just fine.  We had a great spot with a view of the lake and a very short walk for some fishing.  The park host was friendly and informative as were the people at the marina.  We were told the park would close this year for renovations so check before you go.  All sites will be upgraded with sewer hookups and new pad site.  We will definitely check it out when renovations are done.
